title: Worker Protection Modifications

history.action: Bill Numbered but not Distributed in Legislative Research and General Counsel
Numbered Bill Publicly Distributed in Legislative Research and General Counsel

general_provisions: This bill modifies the Utah Labor Code.
hilighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>defines terms;<hr><ltbullet>prohibits an employer from compelling an employee to attend a meeting or listen to communication of an employer's opinion about a religious or political matter;<hr><ltbullet>provides exceptions to the prohibition;<hr><ltbullet>provides a remedy for an employee who is compelled to attend a meeting or listen to communication of an employer's opinion about a religious or political matter;<hr><ltbullet> requires an employer to: <hr><ltbullet1>implement heat risk precautions and cold risk precautions; <hr><ltbullet1>implement recordkeeping requirements pertaining to heat stoke, hypothermia, frostbite, or temperature-related fatalities;<hr><ltbullet1>notify employees with a written description of quotas, adverse actions that may result for failing to obtain a quota, and incentives for meeting a quota;<hr><ltbullet1>provide data pertaining to quotas to a requesting employee;<hr><ltbullet1>implement recordkeeping requirements pertaining to quotas; and<hr><ltbullet1>maintain a workplace safety program for managing risks related to the temperature of the worksite;<hr><ltbullet>provides standards for tracking quotas;<hr><ltbullet>prohibits retaliation against an employee who requests records or files a complaint with the Labor Commission (commission); and<hr><ltbullet>provides for commission enforcement.
